isis.stitle: ALLISON WT TRANSMISSION ELECTRONIC CONTROLS - WT TRANSMISSION DIAGNOSTIC CODES - CODE READING AND CODE CLEARING PROCEDURE

svcproc.title: CODE READING AND CODE CLEARING PROCEDURE

svcprocinfo.para: Diagnostic codes can be read and cleared by two methods: by using the Pro-Link 9000 diagnostic data reading (DDR) tool with the appropriate cartridge or by using the Shift Selector Display. The use of the Pro-Link service tool is described in the instruction manual furnished with each Pro-Link tool and cartridge, and will not be discussed in this manual. The method of reading and clearing codes described in this section refers to only entering the Diagnostic Display Mode by proper button and/or lever movement on the shift selector.

note.para: The diagnostic display mode on the shift selector may only be entered when the vehicle is stopped. The vehicle is stopped when sensor output speed = zero and no output speed sensor failure is active; OR if any output speed sensor failure is active (code 22 16) when turbine speed = zero. Codes may only be cleared under the same circumstances.

svcprocinfo.para: The following describes how to use the shift selector to read and clear codes. Only the shift lever type of selector will be discussed (not the push-button shift selector).

step1.para: The vehicle must be stopped. The transmission should be shifted into neutral and the vehicle park brake applied.

note.para: If a DO NOT SHIFT condition is present at this time, the lever should be left in the same position that it was when the code occurred. If not, the shift selector continuous tone will sound until the lever is returned to the original position.

step1.para: Momentarily depress the DISPLAY MODE BUTTON on the shift selector. Read the first code in the first of five code positions on the digital display on the shift selector. The digital display shows the first code in three steps. For example, code 25 11 located in the first position would be read as follows:

step2.para: First the code list position is displayed as "d1."
Then two seconds later, the display will show the main code 25.
Then two seconds later, the display will show the secondary code 11.
Then, if no further action is taken, the display will rerun the cycle of A., B., C. as described above.

step1.para: To read the second position on the code list, press the MODE DISPLAY BUTTON momentarily and the second code on the list will be displayed in the same manner as in Step 2.

To read positions d3, d4, and d5, momentarily depress the MODE DISPLAY BUTTON as explained in Step 3. Momentarily pressing the DISPLAY MODE BUTTON after viewing the fifth code will cause the first code to be displayed again, etc.

When in the DIAGNOSTIC MODE, the MODE INDICATOR LIGHT will be illuminated when the code being displayed is ACTIVE. When in a normal operating mode, the MODE INDICATOR LIGHT illuminates to show that the transmission is in a secondary mode of operation.

Any code position in the list of five which does not have a diagnostic code logged will display "--" for both the main and sub-code displays. Any code position in the list of five after such a display will also be displayed in the same way (--) as they will not contain any data.
Clearing of the "active indicator" is automatically done at ECU power-down (turn key OFF) on all but one code ( see Code Chart).
Some codes will clear the "active indicator" automatically when the condition causing the code is not detected by the ECU (see WT DIAGNOSTIC CODE LIST).
Manual clearing is possible while in the diagnostic display mode and after the condition causing the code is corrected.

step2.para: To clear all active indicators, hold the MODE BUTTON down continuously until the shift selector tone sounds for 0.5 seconds.
Release the MODE BUTTON to return to normal operation mode. If a code was not active at the time, the active indicator will turn off.
